result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan J. Bessa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jordan J. Bessa is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jordan J. Bessa was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Jordan J. Bessa was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Jordan J. Bessa was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Jordan J. Bessa was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Jordan J. Bessa. 
Calling 22fo128,20cf23,21cm234 and 22cf5.
Sowinski moves to dismiss 20fo128 and dismiss but read in 20cf23 and 21cm234.  Further statement regarding bond in 21cm234 to be used for the Patch and victim in 20cf23- Granted by Court.
in 22cf5 - State moves to dismiss  counts 1 and 5 - Granted
Plea questionnaire filed - No contest plea to counts 2,3,4,6 - Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. 
Sowinski/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court WHS and POP for 3 years - each CC,
Defendant to stay in custody for 7 days or until the day he gets the patch on.  If not on in the 7 days- court will review - 
CC/CV/DNA - $513 count 4 - Court remits all other counts.
 total -Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office. 
Balance of restitution on 20cf23 after $380 bond applied and sent directly to victim to be collected through probation. 
To comply with ADL, wear patch and remain current. 
Submit DNA sample- The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Appeal rights given/Voting rights given.
Case not called on record.  Defendant not appearing via video today per the jail.  Bennett and Mary Sowinski in court and new date for PTC given.
No contact with H.F./Will allow to go to in patient treatment if bed becomes available

09:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jordan J. Bessa appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared telephonically for Jordan J. Bessa. Bennett statement to bond - motion has been filed - waiting for bed at treatment facility - would reside with Mr. Hallock until that time. Sowinski statement to bond. Court modifies bond conditions. adj. 09:05 AM
to modify bond

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan J. Bessa appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Jordan J. Bessa. Calling 20CF23, 21CM234, 22CF5 & 22FO128. Bennett states there is no agreement and would like to set 22CF5 for a 1 day Jury Trial - would also like to set a bond modification hearing. Court states drug analyst may appear by video. Bennett to contact JA on bond hearing. Bond continued. adj. 10:12 AM
Jury Trial scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jordan J Bessa appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brian Bennett appearing by video. Calling 22CF5, 21CM234, 20CF23 & 22OF128. Sowinski states most recent offer has been rejected - statement to Forest County case - would like to set another final pretrial. Bond continued. adj. 09:12 AM
Final pre-trial scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Officer's Supplemental Report
No contact with H.F.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jordan J. Bessa appearing by video, in custody at the Forest County Jail. Calling 22CF5 & 21CM234. Court statement to events of new arrest in Forest County. Pfeifer statement to bond. Defendant statement to charges. Court sets bond. Court states Louis Hallock is never to vouch for someone in his court again. adj. 01:32 PM

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan J. Bessa
Current: 2835 Hancock Lake Rd, Harshaw, WI 54529 United States  (Effective: 02-10-2022)
Prior: 5 Fishermans Paradise, Rhinelander, WI 54501
Bond to be co-signed by Mr. Hallock/Defendant must reside with Mr. Hallock/Defendant must not leave residence unless with Mr. Hallock/Must not have any contact with B.F. of any kind

11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jordan J. Bessa appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared in court for Jordan J. Bessa. Mr. Louis Hallock appearing with Mr. Bennett. Calling 22CF5, 20CF23 & 21CM234. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Bennett willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bennett would like to discuss bond. Court states motion was going to be filed. Bennett states did not file. Bennett/Hallock/Sowinski statement to bond. Court sets bond with conditions. adj. 11:16 AM
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
